overview.ovdesc:
This application stores the details of Status codes used in the document data files TRANS.DOCUMENT.
Records with IDs
1
(Received),
2
(Not Received) and
3
(Expired) are supplied during installation and these records should not be modified, since these Status ID values are used by T24
in processing. While Status
1
is a valid one, both Status
2
and
3
are invalid.
Users could define their own Status codes in this application which could be either Valid or Invalid (Field:
VALID
set to
YES
or
NO
).
This is an installation level application shared by all Companies and records of this application could not be reversed.

desc.p: For a valid status (Value of the Field VALID is YES), this field specifies the period up to which a Document of this status is valid.
The validity period could be calculated either from Status-Date or from its calendar year beginning for a document of this status.
Refer to the help text for the field END.DATE in the file CUST.DOCUMENT for calculation of expiry date using this field.
Example
VALID.PERIOD=Null, No End date would be calculated.
Calculation from Status-Date: VALID.PERIOD= 12M. For a document with this status and a STATUS.DATE of 20.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 19.2.2003.
Calculation from Status-Date's calendar year beginning: VALID.PERIOD= 12MS. For a document of this status and a STATUS.DATE of 20.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 31.12.2002.
Validation Rule
Optional input.
For invalid status (value of the field VALID is NO), no value would be allowed.
Must be in the format xxxD, xxxM or xxxY to specify the number of days, months or years respectively from Status-Date.
Must be in the format xxxDS, xxxMS or xxxYS to specify the number of days, months or years respectively from Status-Date's calendar year beginning.
Description of the status.
Example
Fax copy, Email, Signature incomplete, etc.
Input Mandatory.
1-35 Alpha numeric characters.
Multi language field.
This file stores the details of Status codes used in the document files CUST.DOCUMENT and TRANS.DOCUMENT.
ID can be any positive integer subject to a maximum of 10 characters.
Records with IDs 1 (Received), 2 (Not Received) and 3 (Expired) are supplied during installation and they are used by T24 in processing.
Records in this file could not be reversed.
For user input, 1-10 numeric characters other than the values of 1, 2 or 3.
Specifies whether this status, if attached to a Document tracked for a customer would make it valid (Value of YES) or invalid (Value of NO).
If the status attached to a required document is invalid, then T24 may do additional processing like generating overrides, etc. for the document.
Input mandatory.
Allowed values are YES/NO.
Input not allowed for System generated records with IDs 2 and 3.
